title: 13- Vigils staged demanding gov't to rescind draft income tax bill
content: In the southern governorate of Karak (some 130km from Amman), protesters called for a comprehensive review of economic policies and the introduction of national programs that would alleviate burdens on citizens and slash poverty and unemployment.   In Amman, protesters gathered near the Fourth Circle urging the government to revisit the whole economic approach and search for other alternatives that would guarantee better and stable living conditions.   Similar sit-ins were staged in Zarqa, Irbid, Madaba, Irbid, Salt and Jerash.   //Petra// AA  3/6/2018 - 12:03:13 AM " />   Petra   About Jordan   News   News Details   Amman, June 2 (Petra) -- Hundreds of citizens staged peaceful protests and vigils in Amman and other governorates demanding the government to rescind a draft income tax bill and revisit amendments made to the civil service bylaw.   In the southern governorate of Karak (some 130km from Amman), protesters called for a comprehensive review of economic policies and the introduction of national programs that would alleviate burdens on citizens and slash poverty and unemployment.   In Amman, protesters gathered near the Fourth Circle urging the government to revisit the whole economic approach and search for other alternatives that would guarantee better and stable living conditions.   Similar sit-ins were staged in Zarqa, Irbid, Madaba, Irbid, Salt and Jerash.
